trends: There have been 20 other sightings in Washington
There were no other sightings in Washington on or around February 2nd 2008
Summary: 3 star-shaped objects varying in intensity and color
divs: sighting detailsaround 1am i was sitting on our porch with my friend and brother and we saw two lights due west of us about 60 degrees off the horizon. the other a few degrees north of due west. they which at first appeared to be stars but we noticed they were changing the color of their lights.not much interest at this point. thinking they were planes we kept watching. the more noticeable of the pair was going dim followed by a greater intense brightness, comparable in brightness to stars in the big dipper. followed by dimness, and so forth. it's light was mostly blue and green. the other of the pair was mostly red and orange and also changing brightness. it began getting strange when the red one began moving erratically, in a squarish rising pattern towards the blue one. i figure planes cannot maneuver that quickly and change direction, yet still maintain speed. the blue one continued its dim\bright pattern. at this point i got binoculars. upon closer inspection the blue one was actually shifting between blue\green\red and the red one began moving towards us rapidly. when it was overhead i saw it clearly and it was shaped like a t, and flew overhead without sound, yet probably moving almost the speed of sound, yet compared to its earlier flight pattern i don't feel something like a harrier jet could rise so quickly, change directions and speed rapidly, then pass over without making a sound. it had flown east. after that one left we watched the blue one intently. it began going the opposite direction, further west of us, and disappeared completely from vision within about 4 seconds. i talked to an astromoner and she said iridium flares were in the area, which are old motorola satellites. at 2:45am i called one of the directors of the mufon in the area. he was pissed. if you have a sighting, i suggest not calling at the wee hours of the morning. i have learned that these people have full-time jobs and do not sit around staring at the sky with their hand on the phone ready to pick-up any call about a ufo sighting. which is what i was under the impression of.
